visualization_prompt: Generate a spline chart showing the temporal trend of NASA's budget allocation as a percentage of the U.S. federal budget using annotated historical event markers and reference plot lines
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a univariate time series spanning 66 annual observations (1954-2020) with percentage values (ratio scale). Synthetic data preserves authentic statistical properties of the original NASA budget dataset: μ=1.12%, σ=1.23%, with strong left skew (γ1=1.84) reflecting post-Apollo funding decline. The spline chart optimizes data-ink ratio per Tufte by eliminating markers and using minimal gridlines, while Cairo's principle of perceptual transparency is maintained through distinct pink (#f15c80) and blue (#7cb5ec) plot lines for Cold War space race events. Annotations highlight key statistical anchors (maximum at 4.41% in 1966) while maintaining proportional ink usage through restrained label backgrounds. The 10-year moving average (implicit in spline smoothing) reveals three distinct eras: pre-Apollo growth (1957-1966), post-Apollo decline (1967-1979), and modern stabilization (1980-present).
